resources.string: "The default configuration for new software and devices is often set." "This would usually result in having ‘everything on’ in order for them to be as multi-functional as possible," "and easily usable. However, a major disadvantage to this is that depending on the options set, the device can" "be prone to cyber attackers resulting in consequences such as unauthorised access to data.\n"

"It is important to always check the settings for new devices and software when possible. " "The changes that should be made are the ones that are likely to raise the level of security. " "For example, disabling or removing any functions, accounts, or services that are not required " "can largely boost the security. Please see the provided link for more information on secure configuration.\n"

"Methods to prevent unauthorised access should always be used. " "Passwords, when implemented correctly are a great way of securing access to a device. " "Default passwords should always be changed. These are the passwords that attackers will " "often try first. An example of this is the username ‘admin’ with the password ‘password123’. " "PINs and touch-ID such as fingerprint authentication can also be used. Please see the provided link for more guidance on passwords. \n"

"Accounts with high priority such as banking accounts, administration accounts that have high privileges, should use two factor authentication. " "This consists of two methods of authentication such as a password, with a code that is sent to the smartphone. \n"
"Guidance on securely configuring devices. This will greatly improve the security of your systems \n"
